name: Access Control - User Authentication & Authorization
description: Ensures that access to financial systems and sensitive data is restricted to authorized personnel through proper authentication mechanisms and role-based access controls. Users must be properly identified, authenticated, and authorized before accessing critical financial applications, payment processing systems, or customer data.
validation_criteria: User accounts are created only with proper management approval
Multi-factor authentication is implemented for financial system access
Role-based access controls are properly configured and documented
Access permissions align with job responsibilities and segregation of duties
User access is regularly reviewed and certified by management
Terminated employee access is promptly removed from all systems

name: Access Control - Access Review & Monitoring
description: Ensures that user access to financial systems is regularly reviewed, monitored, and validated to detect unauthorized access attempts, inappropriate privileges, or dormant accounts. This includes monitoring login activities, reviewing access permissions, and ensuring access remains appropriate for current job functions.
validation_criteria: User access reviews are performed at least quarterly
Access review results are documented and retained
Inappropriate or excessive access is identified and remediated
Dormant or inactive accounts are identified and disabled
Failed login attempts and suspicious activities are monitored
Access review findings are escalated to management
Remediation actions are tracked and verified

name: Access Control - Privileged Access Management
description: Ensures that privileged access to critical financial systems, databases, and administrative functions is strictly controlled, monitored, and limited to authorized personnel with legitimate business needs. This includes database administrators, system administrators, and users with elevated financial system privileges.
validation_criteria: Privileged access is granted only with explicit management approval
Privileged accounts are regularly reviewed and certified
Administrative activities are logged and monitored
Shared or generic privileged accounts are prohibited
Privileged access sessions are time-limited when possible
Privileged users undergo additional background screening
Emergency privileged access procedures are documented and controlled

name: Change Management - Change Request & Approval Process
description: Ensures that all changes to production systems, applications, and infrastructure that could impact financial reporting are properly requested, reviewed, approved, tested, and documented. This includes changes to payment processing systems, financial reporting applications, database configurations, and security settings.
validation_criteria: All system changes are initiated through formal change requests
Change requests include business justification and impact assessment
Changes are reviewed and approved by appropriate stakeholders
Technical and business approvals are documented and retained
Emergency changes follow expedited but controlled procedures
Change implementation is documented with rollback procedures
Post-implementation validation confirms successful deployment

name: Change Management - System Change Testing & Validation
description: Ensures that all changes to financial systems undergo appropriate testing in non-production environments before deployment to production. This includes unit testing, integration testing, user acceptance testing, and validation that changes meet business requirements without introducing security vulnerabilities or data integrity issues.
validation_criteria: Changes are tested in dedicated non-production environments
Test plans are developed and executed for all changes
Testing includes functional, integration, and security validation
User acceptance testing is performed by business stakeholders
Test results are documented and reviewed before deployment
Performance impact testing is conducted for significant changes
Regression testing ensures existing functionality remains intact

name: Change Management - Emergency Change Management
description: Ensures that emergency changes to production systems are properly controlled, documented, and subject to expedited approval processes while maintaining appropriate oversight and audit trails. Emergency changes should be limited to critical security fixes or system outages that impact financial operations.
validation_criteria: Emergency change procedures are clearly defined and documented
Emergency changes require senior management approval
Business justification for emergency status is documented
Emergency changes are implemented with appropriate oversight
All emergency changes are logged and tracked
Post-implementation review of emergency changes is conducted
Emergency changes undergo retroactive formal approval process

name: Data Backup & Recovery - Data Backup Procedures & Verification
description: Ensures that critical financial data, transaction records, and system configurations are regularly backed up, properly stored, and can be successfully restored to maintain business continuity and data integrity. This includes customer transaction data, payment records, financial reporting databases, and audit trail information.
validation_criteria: Backup procedures are documented and regularly executed
Critical financial data is backed up according to defined schedules
Backup completion status is monitored and verified
Backup data integrity is regularly tested through restoration tests
Backup media is securely stored with appropriate access controls
Offsite backup storage provides protection against local disasters
Backup retention periods comply with regulatory requirements
Recovery procedures are documented and periodically tested

name: Data Backup & Recovery - Disaster Recovery Testing
description: Ensures that disaster recovery plans and procedures are regularly tested to validate the organization's ability to restore critical financial systems and data following a major disruption. This includes testing backup restoration, system recovery procedures, and business continuity processes.
validation_criteria: Disaster recovery plans are documented and regularly updated
Recovery testing is performed at least annually
Test scenarios include various disaster types and failure modes
Recovery time objectives (RTO) and recovery point objectives (RPO) are defined
Test results are documented and gaps are identified
Recovery procedures are updated based on test findings
Key stakeholders participate in disaster recovery testing
Communication plans are tested as part of recovery procedures

name: Data Backup & Recovery - Data Restoration & Integrity
description: Ensures that data restoration processes maintain the accuracy, completeness, and integrity of financial information when recovering from backups. This includes validation that restored data matches original data, proper handling of transaction logs, and verification of data consistency across related systems.
validation_criteria: Data restoration procedures are documented and tested
Restored data integrity is verified through checksums or validation routines
Transaction logs are properly applied during restoration processes
Data consistency across related systems is validated after restoration
Restoration processes include point-in-time recovery capabilities
Data validation procedures confirm completeness of restored information
Restoration activities are logged and monitored for accuracy
Business users validate restored data before returning to normal operations
